docs.title: Welcome to VectorSearch
docs.text: VectorSearch (VS) is a self-optimizing hybrid indexing system for scalable and memory-efficient vector retrieval.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Quantization-based candidate filtering
  • Lightweight graph refinement
  • Multi-vector support
  • Caching and memory mapping

Start with Getting Started

docs.title: Getting Started with VectorSearch (VS)
docs.text: VectorSearch (VS) is a self-optimizing hybrid indexing system designed for scalable and memory-efficient vector retrieval. This guide walks you through setting up the system and running a sample search on a small dataset.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Ensure your environment is running Ubuntu (20.04 or later). The instructions below are tested on an Azure VM (Standard_E64ds_v4), but they work in any compatible Linux setup.
